intro: Henriettella glazioviana, commonly known as the Glaziov's henriettella, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. Henriettella glazioviana thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and requires a humid, temperate climate. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
